text: Hurricane Hortense cut across Haiti, the Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico in September of 1996. The storm took next to 40 lives and did $139 million in damage. The storm also affected portions of eastern Canada, striking southeastern Nova Scotia as a Category 1 hurricane. The name Hortense was later retired. Category:Category 4 Atlantic hurricanes Category:1996 in weather Category:1996 events Category:Retired tropical cyclone names Category:1990s in weather
title: Hurricane Hortense
